ns:common.topic.description: Standard ML of New Jersey is a compiler and programming environment for Standard ML. Aside from its runtime system, which is written in C, SML/NJ is written in Standard ML. It was developed jointly by Bell Laboratories and Princeton University.\nIts name is a reference both to the state in which Princeton and Bell Labs are located and to Standard Oil of New Jersey, the famous oil monopoly of the early 20th century.
rdfs:label: Standard ML of New Jersey

ns:common.document.text: Standard ML of New Jersey (SML/NJ) is a compiler and programming environment for Standard ML. Aside from its runtime system, which is written in C, SML/NJ is written in Standard ML. It was developed jointly by Bell Laboratories and Princeton University.\nIts name is a reference both to Princeton's home state and to Standard Oil of New Jersey, the famous oil monopoly of the early 20th century.\nSML/NJ extends the SML'97 Basis Library with several additional top-level structures:

ns:type.object.name: Standard ML of New Jersey
